yiṉcelvi Eṇṭicai viḷaṅka nirupar vant-iṟaiñca nīṇila-maṭantaiyait tirumaṇam puṇarntu cirvaḷar
tarumaṇimuṭi kavittanṉ-anṉa Aṇimuṭi-cūṭi mallai-ñālattu-p pall-uyirkk-ellām Ellaiyil-iṉpam-y-iyalvinṉill e
yta veṇkuṭai niḻaṟṟa-c ceṅkolocci vāḻi pallūḻi Appa cempon viīra siṃhāsanṉattu puvanṉam-uḻut-uṭaiyā
ḷoṭum viīṟṟiruntaruḷiya

kō-v-irājakecaripanṉmar-ānṉa tiripuvanṉa-cakkaravarttikaḷ śrī-koulōttuṅka-cōḻa-tēvaṟku Iyāṇtu Iraṇ
ṭ-āvatu

Irājarāja-vaḷa-nāṭṭu-p paṉaiyūr-nāṭṭu vāvalūr-nāṭṭu-t tēvatāṉam tiruvāmāttūr Āḷuṭaiya Aḻakiyatēvar
kōyilil tiruppatiyam pāṭivarum kuruṭarkaḷai tavittu nam tēvārattu tiruppatiyam pāṭum poyyāta-cēvaṭi tēva-kaṇātanṉ-ānṉa
Irājarājap-piccaṉukkum Ivanṉ vaṟkattārkkum Ik-kōyiṟ tiruppatiya-k-kāṇiyāṉa Ivv-ūr mutal-kāṇiyāka kuṭuttōm

Ivanṉ vaṟkattāraiyumē-y Iṭṭu-t tiruppatiyam pāṭu-vittukkoṇṭu muṉpil āṇṭukaḷ kuruṭarkaḷukku viṭṭu varum nivanta
-p-paṭi Ivarkaḷukkum viṭṭuk kalveṭṭuka-v enṟu tiruvāymoḻintu tirumukam pirasātañ ceytu vant-amaiyiṟṉ Ik-kuruṭar

kaḷ muṉpil āṇṭukaḷ Anṉupavattiṉ paṭi pāṭi varuṅ kuruṭarkaḷ pēr-patinṉaṟuvarum Ivarkaḷukku kaṇkāṭṭuvār Iruvarum Ā
kap pēr-patinṉeṇmarkku pērāl nellu patakk-āka nāḷ-oṉṟukku nellu mukkalam-āka nāḷ munṉṉūṟṟ' aṟupatukku nellu Āyi
ratt' eṇpatiṉ kalamum puṭavai-mutalukku pērāl kācu Oṉṟ-āka kācu patinṉeṭṭukku kācu Oṉṟukku nellu Irupatinṉ kalamāka va
nta nellu Āyirattu nānūṟṟu nāṟpatiṉ kalattukku vēli Oṉṟukku nellu nūṟṟ' iru
patiṉ kalamāka It-tēvar tēvatānam kaṭuvanṉ ūril viṭṭa nilam pannṉṉiru vēli In-nilam pannṉṉiru-vēliyum kāṇiyāka

Ivv-ūr nila
ṅ kalanta paṭiyē kai-k koṇṭu It-tiruppatiyam pāṭuvār pēr-patinṉeṇmarum muṉṟu santiyum vantu tiruppatiyam
viṇṇappañ ceytu munṉpil āṇṭukaḷ Ik-kuruṭarkaḷ nilaṅ kai-k koṇṭu ceytu varum paṭiyē It-tiruppatiyam
viṇṇappañ ceyvārum ceytu vara-k-kaṭavarkaḷāka Ip-poyyāta-cevaṭi tēvar kaṇātanṉ-ānṉa rājarāja-p piccaṉukkum Ivanṉ vaṟ
kattārkkuṅ kāṇiyāka kuṭuttōm
The date is the second year of the king Irājakecaripaṉmar, alias Tiripuvaṉa-cakkaravartti Śrī-Kulōttuṅka-cōḻa-tēvar.

We previously gave the land rights kāṇi of this village so they be converted into land rights kāṇi for the recitation of holy hymns tiruppatiyam in the temple. It was given to to Rājarāja Piccaṉ, alias Poyyāta-cevaṭi Tēvakaṉātaṉ, and his relatives vaṟkattār so they sing the holy hymns tiruppatiyam of our Tēvāram after excluding blind people kuruṭar who utter pāṭivar the holy hymns in the temple of god Āḷuṭaiya-Aḻakiyatēvar of the tēvatāṉam Tiruvāmāttūr located in Vāvalūr-nāṭu belonging to Paṉaiyūr-nāṭu in the boundaries of Irājarāja-vaḷa-nātu.

The royal order gracefully grants the gift pirasātam-ceytuvantamai of the hereditary rights by divinely proclaiming: “Let it be written in stone that he and his lineage are appointed the hereditary rights for the singing of holy hymns tiruppatiyam, which in previous years was appointed to the blind men; according to the agreement nivantappaṭi, the rights for the land are taken from them”.
[Measurements of rice and lands with annual and monthly quantities to the reciters are given here.]

We have given hereditary rights kāṇi to Rājarāja Piccaṉ, alias Ippoyyāta-cevaṭi-tēvar, and his lineage, so they become the ones who appoint ceytuvar kaṭavarkaḷ the daily reciters viṇṇappam ceyvār of holy hymns tiruppatiyam, according to the way in which it was done when the land was managed kaikkoṇṭu by the blind men. They formerly made the daily recitation viṇṇappam ceytu of holy hymns tiruppatiyam on the three junctions of the day santi. The eighteen great singers of these holy hymns managed kaikkoṇṭu the land nilam in accordance to how it was distributed kalanpaṭiyē in this village ūr.
